keyword: how many calories in small orange
title: How Many Calories in a Small Orange?
meta_description: Learn how many calories in small orange, plus carbs, fiber, protein, sugars, and full nutrition breakdown for easy tracking.
h1: How Many Calories in a Small Orange?
assumptions: Fresh navel orange, about 96 g whole (peeled and eaten), no added sugar or toppings.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by variety, ripeness, size, and growing conditions. Check labels for packaged products.

quick_answer.text: A small orange provides about 45 kcal, mostly from natural sugars and carbs.

label_note: Values mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison with food packaging.

faqs.q: How many calories in a small orange?
faqs.a: Approximately 45 kcal for one small (96 g) fresh orange.

faqs.q: What are the carbs in a small orange?
faqs.a: About 11 g total carbs, including 2.3 g fiber and 9 g natural sugars.

faqs.q: Does a small orange have protein or fat?
faqs.a: Minimal: 0.9 g protein and 0.1 g fat, making it low-calorie and nutrient-dense.

faqs.q: How does orange size affect calories?
faqs.a: Small: ~45 kcal; medium (~130 g): ~62 kcal; large: ~86 kcal. Adjust based on weight.

faqs.q: Are oranges good for fiber intake?
faqs.a: Yes, one small orange offers 2.3 g fiber, aiding digestion and satiety.
